etymons.meaning: to hollow out, dig; to dig through; to hew out;

translations: ‘Lahdo is carving the rock’ (the rock is being crushed slowly, piece by piece) (Ilyas p.c.) turkish: oyma

Preterit.turoyo: As+sobahkàr koṯən, kəmḥalqi ruḥayye lu+baḥar, koduʕri. Mḥalqi ruḥayye lu+baḥar. Ga, u+zʕuro ínaqqa domar ‘ay’, i+Ndaṯalo nqīr‿ebe. Nqīr‿ebe, mədla ŭ ṭʕəḷḷa.
translations: come, they toss themselves into the sea, they return
. Look, the boy, when he says ‘oh!’, the Theotokos swooped down onto him, she swooped down onto him, she grabbed him and carried him off. (Mother Mary Saves the Sultan’s Son)

Preterit.turoyo: Ono kalyo – u+safruno nqīr ebi ‘I am standing – the bird crashed into me’ (Abdu+Lmasīḥ)
